review: Bought a Samsung smart HTS 2 years ago, 6 months after purchase it started giving me minor problems Went on to purchase a Samsung smart tv and have had much better luck with that  Since I don't use cable, I rely on streaming and antennas and the smart hub in my HTS has been a source of constant aggravation for almost the last year and not being able to stream pretty much puts my largest TV out of business so I began researching alternate options for streaming  My main concerns with a streaming device are that I'm able to stream both Netflix and Hulu, that its reliable, and easy to operate  After researching and reading many reviews I chose to go with the Roku Stick and so far I'm very happy  I love that the stick offers History channel and Lifetime which my smart hub does not  It also has Pandora, Youtube, Crackle, Vudu, MGo, and so many channels my hand would cramp if I tried to type them all  The only reason this isn't getting 5 stars is because there is a bit of lag and I'm not sure you can turn it off without unplugging it and if you can I haven't figured it out so not crazy about it being on all the time  Time will tell how reliable this will turn out to be but for now I am one happy customer
